summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Citibank N.A., dated June 16, 2020, demanding extensive financial records related to a specific account number from January 1, 2005, onward. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Signed the subpoena and is the point of contact for the production of records; referenced in the Declaration of Custodian of Records as the requesting AUSA.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Citibank must appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued to Citibank N.A.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Citibank N.A. Legal Services Intake Unit, 701 East 60th Street North, Sioux Falls, SD 57117
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks extensive financial records from Citibank for a specific account number from January 1, 2005, to the present, indicating a deep financial investigation.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. § 1591), conspiracy to commit sex trafficking (§ 1594(c)), coercion and enticement (§ 2422(b)), transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity (§ 2423(a)), and conspiracy (§ 371).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested Citibank to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The document is a standard legal instrument but reveals an active grand jury investigation in the Southern District of New York in mid-2020 into matters related to the Epstein case.
